page.title: 16Ayr Harbour.
page.content: Ayr and Troon,formerly Railway ports, were privatised in 1981 and are oper_ ated by{Associated British Ports,}a company controlling 19 small ports. A total of 68 staff are employed at Ayr. Ayr is an{exporting port}shipping 500000 tons of{coal}annually to power stations in N.I. This tonnage will double when Kilroot change from oil to coal. 150000 tons of{scrap iron}are shipped to N.Spain and 6000 tons of whisky pass through the port annually. Tonnages imported are small and include{grain,potash & phosphates, {rock_salt and timber}and general {building materials. Currently land is being reclaimed from old railway sidings for warehousing to offer to port users and operations at the dock will enable us to handle ships up to 6000 tons _ double our present capacity.
